text: Michaelina "Mikey" Argy MBE (born 1962) is an English thalidomide survivor and activist. She is a past chair of the National Advisory Committee of the Thalidomide Trust, the organisation through which British thalidomide survivors receive financial support, and is still involved in the media activities of the trust. == Life == She went to Michael Hall, a Steiner school in Ashdown Forest, Sussex. She has two daughters, including TikTok content creator Madeline Argy. She was a candidate for the Independence from Europe party in the 2015 European Parliament election in South East England, but was not elected. == Honours == She was appointed MBE in the 2015 Birthday Honours. She was described as "Campaigner and Member, National Advisory Council, Thalidomide Trust", and the honour was "For services to Thalidomide Survivors". == References == Category:1962 births Category:Living people Category:British health activists Category:People from East Sussex Category:British activists Category:Members of the Order of the British Empire Category:Date of birth missing (living people) Category:British people with disabilities
